data.title: 76 Top SaaS Companies to Know In 2024
data.meta_description: Discover the top software-as-a-service (SaaS) companies. Learn about the latest trends in SaaS and the most successful SaaS companies.
data.text:
Datamation content and product recommendations are editorially independent. We may make money when you click on links to our partners. Learn More.

Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) companies are rapidly gaining popularity across various industries because they offer flexible, scalable solutions that are both cost-effective and easy to implement, making them an ideal fit for businesses of all sizes. This technology model provides agility and adaptability and allows organizations to respond quickly to changing market conditions, making SaaS a key component of digital strategies and helping businesses stay competitive and innovative.

To help you discover the leaders in SaaS innovation and explore new possibilities in 2024, here are our picks for the top 76 SaaS companies along with overviews of their areas of specialization and information about their size and market value.

Data Analytics SaaS Companies

SaaS benefits data analytics firms by introducing scalable cloud solutions for processing, analyzing, and gaining insights from large datasets. It eases operations, accelerates insights, and adapts to changing business needs, helping organizations make informed decisions to drive business growth.

Alteryx

Alteryx is a pioneer SaaS company in analytic process automation with the main objective of speeding up the process of turning data into actionable insights and democratizing data analytics for a wider audience. The company has built a variety of tools to support advanced analytics automation, making it more accessible to data workers, regardless of their skill level.

The Alteryx platform encompasses the entire data analytics lifecycle, from the initial stages of data preparation to the final step of deriving business insights. Key products from Alteryx include the Designer Cloud, a unified platform for data transformation, and Machine Learning, a tool that brings automated ML to businesses of all sizes.

Alteryx’s market capitalization was $3.42 billion as of the beginning of 2024, indicating a year-on-year growth of 2.20 percent.

Founded: 1997

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 2,300

Key Products:

Alteryx AI Platform for Enterprise Analytics

AiDIN

Designer Cloud

Machine Learning

Intelligence Suite

Baremetrics

Baremetrics, a SaaS company composed of a small but devoted team, has successfully established a remarkable presence in the competitive data analytics industry. Numerous businesses from diverse sectors place their trust in the company to interpret their data, enabling them to formulate effective growth strategies.

Baremetrics operates a single, integrated platform that covers multiple features, each delivering unique insights and metrics that support businesses in making data-driven decisions. Features within this platform include Metrics for real-time performance tracking, and Recover, for addressing failed payments. These features, consolidated into one Baremetrics platform, have proven to be essential for businesses seeking to maximize their data utilization.

Presently, the company has $2.8 billion in revenue and has more than 850 customers worldwide.

Founded: 2014

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 15

Key Products:

Baremetrics platform

Databricks

Databricks, a significant name in the data analytics sector of the SaaS industry, was established by the creators of Apache Spark, Delta Lake, and MLflow. The company created the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform, a unified solution for comprehensive analytics for enterprise-level data and AI technologies.

This platform introduces AI capabilities to your data, so you can implement AI solutions on a global scale. It also has a suite of tools that allow you to consolidate your data sources into a single platform for processing, storing, sharing, analyzing, modeling, and monetizing datasets.

As of 2024, Databricks has a market cap of $65.5 billion, with revenues reaching $2.62 billion in the past year. Currently, over 9,000 organizations globally depend on Databricks for large-scale data engineering, collaborative data science, full-lifecycle ML, and business analytics.

Founded: 2013

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 5,500

Key Products:

Databricks Platform

MosaicML

Data Management

Data Warehousing

Real-Time Analytics

Domo

Domo is a SaaS data analytics business which is a pioneer in creating data experiences in the cloud, making data accessible and actionable for everyone. The Domo platform is built on a secure data foundation and uses AI and data science for intuitive dashboards and apps, enabling businesses to make the most out of their data for impactful business decisions.

Domo’s product suite includes Business Apps for business insight automation, BI and Analytics for reporting and dashboards, and a Data Foundation for real-time data integration. These solutions aid businesses in making informed decisions quickly using both low-code and pro-code apps.

Currently, Domo’s market capitalization stands at around $363.25 million.

Founded: 2010

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 967

Key Products:

Domo Data Experience Platform

App Creation Tools

Embedded Analytics

Sisense

Sisense is a SaaS data analytics provider offering an extensive solution that allows businesses to build and disseminate reports, effectively manage their data, seamlessly integrate with existing applications, and customize data to suit their unique needs. But what truly sets it apart is its ability to uncover crucial information that can drive strategic decision-making.

Among the most sought after offerings from the company are Sisense Fusion Embed and Sisense Cloud. Sisense Fusion Embed allows businesses to integrate customized analytics into their applications and products, enhancing user engagement and adoption. On the other hand, Sisense Cloud is a cloud-based service that offers a secure, high-performance BI environment with unlimited scalability, stress-free maintenance, and zero-touch upgrades.

Sisense’s exact market cap and growth rate for 2024 are not publicly disclosed.

Founded: 2004

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 400

Key Products:

Fusion Embed

Sisense Cloud

Fusion Compose SDK

Splunk

Splunk Inc. is a data analytics SaaS company with a strong focus on data collection, management, and analysis, supporting businesses around the world in maintaining their digital infrastructures. Splunk’s platform covers varying solutions for threat detection, cloud migration, incident investigation, and IT modernization.

The company’s product lineup includes the Splunk Cloud Platform and Splunk Enterprise Security. These offerings come with ML, data streaming, scalable indexing, and user-friendly dashboards. They are engineered to assist organizations in mitigating security, infrastructure, and application incidents, adapting to digital disruptions, and accelerating digital transformation.

In 2024, Splunk’s market cap is around $26.40 billion, and it has increased its Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) by 15 percent to $4.2 billion in the fiscal year 2024. Cisco acquired Splunk in March 2024.

Founded: 2003

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 7,700

Key Products:

Splunk Cloud Platform

Splunk Enterprise

Splunk Enterprise Security

Splunk SOAR

Splunk Infrastructure Monitoring

Human Resources SaaS Companies

SaaS transforms human resource (HR) processes through its flexible and efficient cloud-based services for HR-related tasks, such as hiring, onboarding, performance tracking, payroll, and employee engagement. Using SaaS models allows HR teams to swiftly adjust to evolving requirements, gain immediate insights, and fine-tune workforce management.

ADP

ADP is a major human capital management (HCM) SaaS company with an extensive global reach, serving more than 810,000 businesses in over 140 countries. It is renowned for its cloud-based solution that integrates HR, payroll, talent, time, tax, and benefits administration into strategic business tools. Its products include the all-in-one HR platform, ADP Workforce Now, and the multi-country payroll solution, ADP Global Payroll.

At present, ADP’s market cap stands at approximately $103.92 billion.

Founded: 1949

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 63,000

Key Products:

ADP Workforce Now

ADP Global Payroll

ADP Vantage HCM

ADP Enterprise HR

ADP TotalSource

BambooHR

BambooHR is known in the SaaS market for delivering effective solutions for complex HR management challenges to over 30,000 customers across different industries.

The BambooHR software suite encompasses tools for tracking job applicants, maintaining employee databases, and managing HR information. Together, these facilitate the handling of employee data from recruitment to retirement, offering a cost-effective and organized approach to HR management.

BambooHR continues to expand its reach, with its hiring rates increasing by 25 percent in the US and 27 percent globally from December 2023 to February 2024.

Founded: 2008

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 1,200

Key Products:

BambooHR platform

Gusto

Gusto is a well-known HR SaaS company that offers an integrated cloud-based platform for payroll, benefits, and HR services to businesses worldwide. Once known as ZenPayroll, Gusto has expanded its reach to more than 300,000 organizations.

The company’s SaaS platform includes tools for payroll processing, employee benefits management, time tracking, recruitment and onboarding, and talent management. It handles a significant amount of data, processing billions of dollars in payroll annually and dealing with various employee benefits. Additionally, the Gusto platform comes with reporting and analytics features.

Gusto has achieved remarkable growth with a revenue of $500 million in its most recent fiscal year.

Founded: 2011

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 2,400

Key Products:

Payroll software

Time tools

HR software

Talent management software

Hiring and onboarding software

Rippling

Rippling is an HR SaaS company that provides a cloud-based platform for businesses to manage their HR, IT, and finance operations. The company is dedicated to reducing the administrative burden of running a business by offering a product portfolio with tools such as an applicant tracking system, payroll and benefits management, time tracking, learning management, and professional employer organization services.

Rippling operates globally and has established licensed subsidiaries to handle specialized services in insurance, professional employer organization (PEO), and payments. As of 2024, Rippling 2024 valuation is $11.2 billion.

Founded: 2016

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 2,817

Key Products:

HR Cloud

Time & Attendance

Talent Management

IT Cloud

App Management

Sage

Sage is a worldwide SaaS provider aiding small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) to perform HR tasks efficiently with Sage HR. Sage HR comes with core HR features for workforce management, shared calendar for employees, timesheets, performance management, and recruitment. Aside from delivering cloud-based solutions for HR, Sage also assists businesses in handling their payroll, accounting, and customer engagement.

Key products from Sage’s portfolio include Sage HR, Sage 50 Accounting, Sage X3, and Sage Business Cloud People. These tools are designed to make employee management, payment, and tracking hassle-free. They have leave management, reporting, performance management, shift scheduling, time tracking, job ad creation, and expenses management features.

Currently, the market cap of Sage Group stands at around $15.84 billion. The company has demonstrated impressive growth, with its stock price rising 63.86 percent from the past year.

Founded: 1981

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: More than 11,000

Key Products:

Sage HRMS

Sage People

Sage 50 Accounting

Sage Intacct

Sage X3

Workday

Workday Inc is a distinguished HR SaaS enterprise that brings cloud-based services for human and financial resource management. Its integrated system includes software for financial management, HCM, and student information systems.

Workday HCM has human resource management, employee engagement, business process management, reporting and analytics, and employee and manager self-service. It also has Workday Skills Cloud, which uses machine learning (ML) to automatically align talent with opportunities. These applications are built to optimize business operations, refine workforce management, and offer real-time reporting and analytics. Workday Inc has over 50 million users worldwide, generates revenues exceeding $5 billion, and operates in over 170 countries.

By 2024, Workday has achieved a market capitalization of $71.8 billion, reflecting its massive growth and strong position in the market.

Founded: 2005

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 18,800

Key Products:

Enterprise Management Cloud

Workday Adaptive Planning

Workday Financial Management

Workday Professional Services Automation

Employee Voice

Project Management SaaS Companies

SaaS offers cloud-based project management platforms that support project planning, collaboration, and resource allocation, boosting productivity and reducing costs. SaaS project management platforms help teams coordinate workflows, track progress, and communicate effectively across different locations and time zones.

Asana

Asana is known for offering solutions that promote team collaboration and streamline workflows.

It primarily offers an all-in-one platform that is designed to enhance productivity and teamwork. The Asana platform, while being a single product, is highly versatile and can be customized to fit unique business needs. It comes with features for task management, project management, workflow automation, and data management. It also has capabilities for reporting, data modeling, and time tracking.

At present, Asana has a market capitalization of $4.47 billion, reflecting a growth of 37.73 percent

Founded: 2008

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C

Company Size: 1,782

Key Products:

Asana platform

Atlassian

Atlassian is a global SaaS company heavily focused on project management and team collaboration. It developed several products, including Jira for tracking issues and projects, Confluence for document collaboration, and Trello for managing personal projects. The company also developed Jira Product Discovery, a prioritization and roadmapping tool for product teams, and Jira Service Management, an ITSM software for high-velocity teams.

Atlassian’s market cap is presently around $54.26 billion.

Founded: 2002

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 10,726

Key Products:

Jira Software

Jira Service Management

Confluence

Trello

Opsgenie

ClickUp

ClickUp delivers a SaaS platform that is not only designed to cater to various sectors such as development, HR, and marketing, but can also be a valuable tool for individual users seeking to work on their personal productivity. This customizable and feature-rich platform consolidates project management, AI, document collaboration, and goals. Additionally, it integrates with over 1,000 other work tools, centralizing data across the tech stack into a single secure workspace.

As of 2024, ClickUp reported an interest in the platform growing to 2 percent from the past year.

Founded: 2017

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C

Company Size: 826

Key Products:

ClickUp platform

ClickApps

ClickUp AI

monday.com

monday.com is a well-reputed SaaS company that offers a highly adaptable cloud-based project management platform that lets businesses create their own work management tools and applications. This platform is customizable to fit different business operations, making it a versatile tool for many industries.

monday.com has also developed mondayDB, which enables organizations of all sizes to build and handle workflows at scale while ensuring high performance and data security. monday.com’s market cap in 2024 stands at around $10.43 billion, reflecting a growth of 28.71 percent from 2023.

Founded: 2012

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C

Company Size: 1,854

Key Products:

monday work management

monday dev

monday CRM

mondayDB

NetSuite

NetSuite is a leading provider of cloud-based business management platform, which includes a project management SaaS solution that facilitates collaboration and real-time project status updates. Other NetSuite products include ERP, accounting, global business management, and CRM software.

Acquired by Oracle in 2016, this SaaS company operates as a distinct business unit, maintaining its brand while benefiting from Oracle’s resources. NetSuite’s integrated approach to business processes sets it apart, presenting a unified view of business operations.

In terms of revenue, NetSuite’s peak quarterly revenue was $12.5B billion in the first quarter of 2024.

Founded: 1998

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 20,068

Key Products:

Project management SaaS solution

Enterprise resource planning (ERP) software

Global business management solution

Customer resource management (CRM) software

Human resource (HR) management tools

Notion

Notion is a reputable name in the project management SaaS that developed an integrated platform for note-taking, task management, and data organization. This platform uses a unique “blocks” concept, which gives you a flexible way to organize your data. It also includes database and spreadsheet capabilities, relational databases, linked databases, and customizable page layouts.

By 2024, Notion has experienced significant growth, with its user base expanding from 1 million to 30 million in just three years, including 4 million paying customers. This growth has resulted in a market valuation of $10 billion for the company.

Founded: 2013

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C

Company Size: 500

Key Products:

AI

Docs

Wikis

Projects

Calendar

Smartsheet

Smartsheet Inc. introduces an innovative SaaS platform for flexible work management and team collaboration. Its user base is diverse, with small businesses, nonprofits, and over 80 percent of Fortune 500 companies using its services.

The Smartsheet platform has a distinctive approach to data; it blends the granular control of a spreadsheet with the robust capabilities of a feature-rich project management solution. It presents a real-time snapshot of project tasks, and has real-time collaboration, automation, and project planning features. Its user-friendly apps also lets you create intuitive web and mobile apps with no coding skills required.

At present, Smartsheet experienced a 0.49 percent market increase over the previous year.

Founded: 2005

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: Over 3,000

Key Products:

The Smartsheet Platform

Smartsheet Advance

Brandfolder by Smartsheet

Resource Management by Smartsheet

Wrike

Wrike is a SaaS project management company with an all-in-one enterprise-grade platform for businesses to oversee and monitor their tasks, projects, schedules, and other processes in real time. This platform comes with time tracking, project planning and organization features, as well as team communication and collaboration tools.

The Wrike platform has advanced analytics and shareable dashboards to transform raw data into actionable insights. Additionally, it allows you to access, import, and export enterprise data while upholding data protection at every touchpoint with AES256 bit encryption and multi-site data redundancy.

The company reported a 60 percent surge in accounts valued over $250,000. Wrike was acquired by Citrix in 2021.

Founded: 2006

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: More than 1,000

Key Products:

Wrike Work Management Platform

Wrike Integrate

Wrike Two-Way Sync

Wrike Lock

AI SaaS

Artificial intelligence (AI) enables SaaS companies to harness machine learning, natural language processing, and other AI techniques to deliver cloud-based solutions across various industries. AI SaaS companies can help businesses and organizations tailor their offerings based on user behavior, preferences, and historical data, enabling them to adapt to customers’ needs and the ever-changing market.

Arize AI

Arize AI offers an AI observability and LLM evaluation platform specifically designed to help businesses monitor, troubleshoot, and improve their AI models in production environments. This platform focuses on enhancing the performance and reliability of machine learning models in real-world applications. By providing insights into the performance of an AI model, businesses and organizations can confidently deploy their AI solutions with accuracy. Through Arize AI, businesses and organizations can bridge the gap between the development process and deployment, paving the way for innovation and growth.

Currently, Arize AI has secured a funding amount of $61 million.

Founded: 2020

Type of SaaS Company: B2B SaaS company

Company Size: More than 50

Key Products:

Arize AI Platform

Atomic AI

Atomic AI is one of the leading AI companies within the field of radiology, applying deep learning to microscopy data at atomic resolutions. Atomic AI’s proprietary platform combines machine learning and structural biology to unlock RNA drug discovery. This well-funded and early-stage biotech company is revolutionizing the fusion of AI and biology with its unique research and development platform, offering new methods for treating or curing undruggable diseases by targeting the eRNA structure. Its interdisciplinary team consists of experts in AI, machine learning, genomics, engineering, and physics.

Founded: 2021

Type of SaaS Company: B2B SaaS company

Company Size: 11 to 50

Key Products:

Atomic AI Platform

Clarifai

Clarifai offers a platform for building AI-powered software solutions and specializes in computer vision. Its platform supports the full AI development cycle, which includes dataset preparation, model training, and deployment. Through Clarifai, businesses and developers can understand images and videos by leveraging powerful machine-learning models. Users can leverage large language models (LLMs) to craft contextually rich content and connect image generation models for more detailed visualizations, descriptive narratives, and lifelike voice outputs.

At present, Clarifai has raised a total of $100 million in funding over four rounds and is backed by 19 investors.

Founded: 2013

Type of SaaS Company: B2B SaaS company

Company Size: 51 to 200

Key Products:

AI Lake™

Scribe Label

Spacetime Search

Computer Vision

Generative AI

IBM

IBM is a major figure in the AI SaaS industry with advanced technological solutions tailored to businesses worldwide. Leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, IBM offers a wide selection of services tailored to optimize business operations, enhance decision-making processes, and drive innovation.

At its core, IBM harnesses AI to equip businesses with insights derived from data analysis, predictive modeling, and cognitive computing. The company’s AI solutions assist organizations in unlocking the full potential of their data by detecting patterns and automating tasks to increase efficiency and productivity.

Key products such as IBM Watson, IBM Cloud Pak for Data, and IBM Watson Studio exemplify the company’s commitment to AI-driven innovation. These platforms provide businesses with tools for data management, ML, and natural language processing.

The company’s market cap as of 2024 is $169.48 billion

Founded: 1911

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 282,200

Key Products:

IBM Watson

IBM Watson Assistant

IBM Watson Discovery

IBM Watson Studio

IBM Cloud Pak

OpenAI

OpenAI is one of the most well-known players in the AI domain, operating on a SaaS model, and catering to various businesses’ AI needs. The company is dedicated to making the benefits of artificial general intelligence (AGI) accessible to humanity as a whole. It contributes substantially to the advancement of AI with its several renowned AI models, including GPT-3, a sophisticated language model, and DALL-E, for generating digital images from textual descriptions. These products have been instrumental in driving the company’s growth and solidifying its position in the AI industry.

As of 2024, OpenAI’s market value is estimated to be approximately $80 billion, with revenue projections escalating from $10 million in 2022 to $200 million in 2023 and reaching $1 billion in 2024. This remarkable growth underscores OpenAI’s ambitious expansion plans and the value placed on its AI capabilities.

Founded: 2015

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 624

Key Products:

GPT-4

DALL·E

Whisper

ChatGPT

UiPath

UiPath is a leading figure in the AI and automation sector with a powerful platform that allows businesses from different industries to automate their processes. Through AI, UiPath refines its Robotic Process Automation (RPA) technology with advanced features like computer vision, unattended robotics, and integration with cognitive services.

The AI capabilities integrated into UiPath optimizes developer productivity and automation development. From language processing and translation to computer vision and document understanding, UiPath’s AI-powered automation workflows cover a broad spectrum of functionalities.

Key products such as UiPath Apps and Automation Cloud show how the company prioritizes innovation. UiPath Apps makes use of Generative AI to aid developers in creating workflows and building automation-powered apps from PDFs or images. Meanwhile, Automation Cloud offers the full UiPath Platform for flexibility in automating any process.

As of 2024, UiPath has a market capitalization of $13.30 billion. Additionally, its ARR soared by 22 percent year-over-year to $1.4 billion.

Founded: 2005

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 3,833

Key Products:

UiPath Business Automation Platform

UiPath Studio

UiPath Apps

Automation Cloud

AI Center

Cloud SaaS Companies

The SaaS companies in this category provide a range of cloud services to individuals, small-to-medium businesses (SMBs), and enterprises, including productivity software, workplace collaboration, and creativity.

Adobe

Adobe Inc., formerly Adobe Systems Incorporated, is a global software giant known for its wide range of products related to digital media and marketing with intelligent capabilities. This SaaS company has been creating innovative products for the last 40 years, enabling customers to express their creativity, manage document processes, and deliver an excellent customer experience. Adobe also commits to conserving natural resources by helping eliminate environmental impacts brought by physical software manufacturing, packaging, and distribution.

Adobe generated $19.41 billion in revenue in 2023, and its market capitalization is currently valued at $234.78 billion.

Founded: 1982

Type of SaaS Company: B2C and B2C SaaS company

Company Size: 29,000

Key Products:

Photoshop

Illustrator

Firefly

Acrobat Pro

Premier Pro

AfterEffects

Cisco

Cisco Systems Inc. is a multinational conglomerate that provides IT products and services across major technology areas. Cisco specializes in networking, security, and collaboration solutions, helping businesses deliver exceptional digital experiences with secure cloud-native applications. It develops and manufactures hardware and software products ranging from cybersecurity appliances and applications to data center solutions.

At present, Cisco has a market capitalization of $198.64 billion.

Founded: 1984

Type of SaaS Company: B2B SaaS company

Company Size: 10,000

Key Products:

Telco Cloud

Cisco Duo

Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client

Cisco CloudCenter

Cisco WebEx

GoTo

GoTo, previously recognized as LogMeIn, is a cloud-based SaaS organization with a focus on remote work technologies. The company underwent a rebranding process in 2022, changing the name GoTo. Its product suite supports flexible and remote work environments by bringing robust collaboration tools, IT management solutions, and cybersecurity technologies. GoTo also conducts services related to data management, including data backup and disaster recovery.

As of 2024, GoTo’s market capitalization stands at an estimated $5.44 billion. The company’s revenue growth is projected at a rate of 12.2 percent annually, and it is expected to reach profitability within the next three years.

Founded: 2003

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C

Company Size: More than 3,500

Key Products:

GoTo Connect

GoTo Meeting

GoTo Webinar

GoTo Contact Center

Google

Google is an integral part of Alphabet Inc. with a major stake in cloud-based services and SaaS. Its Google Cloud Platform (GCP) has varied services including computing, data storage, and analytics. Google’s SaaS solutions, such as Google Docs and Google Sheets, are internet-based, eliminating the need for local software installation. Its infrastructure handles over 2.5 exabytes of data daily, offering complete data handling and analysis resources.

Presently, Google’s market cap is $1.798 trillion. Its 2024 revenue is projected to grow by 11.5 percent.

Founded: 1998

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C

Company Size: 182,502

Key Products:

Android

Chrome

Google Cloud

Youtube

Looker

Microsoft

Microsoft is a prominent player in the cloud computing and SaaS industry with popular products like Azure, a comprehensive cloud computing platform; Power BI, a business intelligence tool that delivers insights for data analysis; and Dynamics 365, a set of intelligent business applications. These products form part of Microsoft’s data platform, which enables you to connect to and use cloud-based applications via the Internet.

Microsoft’s market capitalization stands at $3.09 trillion as of 2024. Over the past year, its market cap has seen a rise of 62.80 percent.

Founded: 1975

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C

Company Size: 221,000

Key Products:

Azure

Microsoft Power Platform

Power BI

Dynamics 365

Xbox

MongoDB

MongoDB, Inc. is a distinguished name in the cloud SaaS space as the developer of the open-source database, MongoDB. This platform facilitates building scalable applications with evolving data schemas.

The company also offers MongoDB Atlas, a developer data platform that operates across multiple clouds, Atlas Search, an embedded full-text search in MongoDB Atlas, and Atlas Charts, a visual representation tool for MongoDB data. These products collectively form an integrated suite of data services, expediting the process of data-driven application development.

Currently, MongoDB’s market cap is around $33.56 billion, with a one-year growth of 104.94 percent.

Founded: 2007

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 4,619

Key Products:

Atlas

Enterprise Advanced

Atlas CLI

Atlas Charts

Compass

Oracle

Oracle is a tech giant in the cloud SaaS industry that delivers a comprehensive suite of cloud applications and infrastructure services that allow businesses to implement changes swiftly and build applications efficiently.

Oracle manages Java, a widely-used programming language, and MySQL, a popular open-source database system. This SaaS company also has enterprise-grade solutions for enterprise resource planning (ERP), enterprise performance management, supply chain management (SCM), and human capital management (HCM). Its data management products, including the Oracle Database, provide end-to-end data lifecycle management and faster insights.

Oracle’s market cap has grown by 29.20 percent over the past year, with remarkable revenue growth in its cloud services.

Founded: 1977

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 164,000

Key Products:

MySQL

Java

Oracle Database

PeopleSoft

E-Business Suite

Salesforce

Salesforce is a SaaS titan specializing in services for customer relationship management (CRM) and enterprise applications. Its solutions are built to enhance customer service, automate marketing, provide analytics, and support application development.

The Customer 360 platform, a notable offering from Salesforce, consolidates customer data from various sources, systems, and devices. Other key products from the company include Einstein, an AI for CRM, and Tableau, a visual analytics solution. These services are aimed at improving CRM and fostering digital transformation. With AI across all products, Salesforce increases productivity and elevates customer experience.

Salesforce’s market cap is $290.78 billion as of 2024, which has grown by 61.49 percent in a year.

Founded: 1999

Type of SaaS Company: B2B

Company Size: 72,682

Key Products:

Service Cloud

Sales Cloud

Customer 360

Einstein

Tableau

Slack

Slack Technologies LLC (Slack Technologies) offers the best solutions for centralized business communications and workplace collaboration. Salesforce acquired Slack in July 2021, which led to the development of Slack-first Customer 360 that integrates Slack and Salesforce’s suite of CRM tools. Slack is now a core component of Salesforce’s Customer 360, which enables businesses to consolidate business-critical workflows in one unified platform.

As of 2024, Slack’s market capitalization was around $26.51 billion.

Founded: 2009

Type of SaaS Company: B2C and B2C SaaS company

Company Size: 2,545

Key Products:

Slack Connect

SurveyMonkey

SurveyMonkey, formerly Momentive, is a leading SaaS company and a global survey platform that offers solutions for creating customized forms and surveys. SurveyMonkey caters to 17 million active users, answering 20 million questions asked daily. SurveyMonkey Genius, another flagship product, is powered by AI and machine learning to help users design better surveys and collect insights quickly.

SurveyMonkey was acquired by Symphony Technology Group (STG) in a deal valued at around $1.5 billion. Presently, SurveyMoney’s market capitalization is estimated at $3.13 billion.

Founded: 1999

Type of SaaS Company: B2B and B2C SaaS company

Company Size: 1,000 to 5,000

Key Products:

SurveyMonkey Forms

SurveyMonkey Genius

Veeva Systems

Veeva Systems is a popular cloud-based software company specializing in industry cloud solutions for life sciences. Its products leverage innovative technologies, integrating software, data, and services to power research and development. Veeva primarily helps with clinical data management, regulatory compliance, quality validation, informed scientific engagement, and other critical medical functions.

Presently, Veeva Systems has a market capitalization of $36.99 billion.

Founded: 2007

Type of SaaS Company: B2B SaaS company

Company Size: 5,000 to 10,000

Key Products:

Bottom Line: Saas Companies

The Software as a Service model offers access to software that comes with a wide range of benefits: they don’t need to install, host, or maintain it; it’s infinitely scalable; and it’s designed for multi-tenancy, which means the cost of operations benefits from the economies of scale. This paves the way for businesses of all sizes—from SMBs to enterprise organizations—to take advantage of the tools and technologies they need while minimizing costs and remaining flexible and adaptable to change. The companies on this list represent some of the most innovative, popular SaaS offerings available today, making it easier than ever to find the right ones for your business needs.

If you’re interested in learning more about the technology companies shaping enterprise industries, read our research on the Top 100 AI Companies, Top Big Data Companies, and Top Cloud Service Providers for 2024.
